title: Has Romesh Ranganathan uncovered a secret society of cats in Gravenhurst?
text:
We all have pride in our hometown, and sometimes it stems from unlikely places – like the shop round the corner from where you grew up that used to sell the best ice lollies for 5p, or a random takeaway that gives out freebies to its favourite customers. We’re not talking about Big Ben or Brighton Pavilion, we’re talking about amazing places that only locals know about.

In Greg James’ case, his favourite place in his nan’s hometown, Weymouth, is the local WHSmith, which in his opinion isn’t just any stationary shop. “It’s central. It’s a meeting point. When I used to visit my nan or my cousins there, it would be like: ‘Meet you at Smiths.’ It’s in the middle of two shopping streets, intersects them. It’s great in wet weather, you can skip to a different street. That’s the best thing about Weymouth.”

So in the spirit of shouting out the most amazing hidden secrets from your local area, we had Romesh Ranganathan on the phone answering listeners’ calls. They all had their favourite hometown hotspot, and some shout-outs were more convincing than others.

Here are some of the places we found out about...

Gravenhurst in Bedford has a secret cat headquarters

That’s according to listener Anna, who claims she’s driven past a specific house several times after 11pm, only to see the same communion of cats hanging outside the front door.

It’s the talk of the town, she says, and she even wonders if felines from nearby villages might be flocking from afar to hang out at this house. Although we’re unsure if the owner of said residence is aware of her home’s appeal to cats.

“I would be concerned if my house had become some kind of cat headquarters,” Romesh said, and he had a point.
description: Here's what happened when Radio 1 listeners gave their hometown’s secret landmarks
